reviews_data.review_text: If they don't have this food in heaven I don't ever wanna die or hell I don't know where I'm going yet
The coffee was good, but I was expecting a little bit more from the croissants. They were very stale. Fresh pastries should be crisp, crunchy, layered and crumbly. You can't serve stale croissants.

The food is great, but after we went through the line, a fruit tart was set out and we asked the cashier, Amy, if she could get someone to add this to our order since it was not available before. She rolled her eyes and held up her hands showing she didn't have gloves on and rudely walked away and put on a glove with attitude. We apologized for the inconvenience and she just rolled her eyes again. Lastly, we asked if there was skim milk, and instead of just saying no, she re-listed all the milks with attitude. Terrible service.

We loved our visits! We went twice during our visit to Charlotte. The decor was whimsical and charming. The pastries were outstanding, we had tarts, macarons, croissants and danish. Also, our lattes were delicious! I wish I lived closer!
Very good selection of French pastries at prices you'd expect for good patisserie here in the US.
Mediocre desert. When fresh it's above average. WHEN it's fresh!

One of the joys of driving family / friends to the Charlotte Douglas airport is stopping at Amelie's on my way home to Winston-Salem.  I always get some fresh croissants, a treat ( strawberry tart and a cup o' joe for the road!  Yum!!!

I frequent Amelie's and have been a customer going on 7 years.I was at NoDa store today and made about $40 purchase, while waiting I overheard a guy mentioned he was celebrating a birthday. The cashier volunteered that Amelie's celebrate birthdays by giving free eclairs(FYI 'all' customers). So I told the cashier I just had a birthday last week - she scrunched up her face and went to clear it with a manager before giving me the free eclair(which was confusing to me).I was not sure if it was the date or the offer was for only 'certain' customers. Starbucks and a lot of of similar businesses have the same offer for their customers. I really enjoy Amelie's food and drinks.
I live in Charlotte and this is still my go to for amazing pastries and sandwiches!

Great bakery. We've been to the three locations many times. Fresh pastries and friendly personnel. Sadly not a place where kids and families are very welcome by some of the staff.  ::::::::Some staff need to be trained in customer service to treat customers fairly and be inclusive to families with kids::::::::  This review goes for a very uncomfortable experience we had on this location. There were a few kids plying in the patio for a while. Their family left and when my son came inside, a customer sitting nearby came to us to complain that we were opening the door too much and the cold was coming in. My son had only opened the door that one time. I told her that he had just come in that time. The lady was on her laptop, on a meeting and clearly too busy to pay attention to what really happened. She had just also told another customer that he couldn't sit on the table next to her because she was on her meeting. (The guy said, but it's only me, I'm alone) The lady got upset, and went to get the manager. I was ok with that, as I expected the manager to ask first to know what had happened before making decisions. To my surprise, the person who came (girl with black hair dyed white and blue in the front) came over assuming that the lady complaining was totally right. She didn't ask even once about what happened before she went ahead calling our son to come back inside because she was going to lock that door. I went there and asked her why, I was trying to explain what happened. She wasn't interested in knowing our side of the story. She misunderstood me, and somehow heard I was calling her stupid, which I swear I wouldn't do. She was just really not in a good emotional place to be objective and/or calm. I can tell she was young, so I attribute this to her inexperience. However, it is not justified. I told her, hey, I don't want to fight with you, but you should give me a chance to speak too. Obviously, I felt offended as she said she had to ask me to leave just because I was trying to explain to her that we were not the ones opening the door. Honestly, I don't even know how you get to this point just because of a door and a misunderstanding. If you are representing a business which market is clearly a lot of families, you must know how to talk through these situations. I'm a mother and, of course I'm not the only customer that matters, but it DOES MATTER how you communicate things to customers. It DOES MATTER your willingness to be fair, to be respectful, to be kind, to listen, to be INCLUSIVE with your customers. Don't take sides, first LISTEN and then find a middle ground. And above it all NEVER talk like that to your customers. Let them also explain themselves. You can do better than this.

Amelie's is my favorite Charlotte bakery. I have yet to try an item I didn't like. I usually go to the NoDa location, which has just a wonderful environment to enjoy your food. On my most recent trip, I brought a friend from out of town, and she ended up taking several tarts, and various other pastries with her back home. She is still raving about them and wants to know when she can get an Amelies in her town.

OMG!!!!!  This place is AMAZING!!!  The pastries are so fresh, taste amazing and the decor is cute.   We were close by and saw the multiple excellent ratings and decided to give it a shot.  It was so worth it.   If you're in the neighborhood you need to pass by and try it.   You won't be disappointed.
Love the spreads and tartines
A french bakery that even has gluten free items, Yay!  The food and coffee are awesome.

I never made it to Amelie's when I lived in Charlotte but have always recommended it to anyone planning a visit to Charlotte. I finally made it!! It's wonderful! Yes, the line was long, but worth the wait.  The staff was friendly, helpful, took their time and answered questions about all the pastries offered. Coffee was fresh and a perfect compliment to the pastries. Macarons are amazing!! Everything was delicious! The atmosphere is so eclectic and fun. We loved it!
Super cute little place! Glad I stopped here!
Absolutely wonderful.
Really good service I'm really appreciate
Gotta try them.  Macaroons are what they are known for
Love this place wish they would go back to the original hours ‚ù§Ô∏è
The food was authentic! The display of pastries were amazing. I hate that I didn't get pictures!

I go here all the time but yesterday my friend and I went for lunch and the girl at the counter was THE SWEETEST!!! She took her tine with us, offered us soup samples cause we couldnt decide and was just very kind in general. I love this place and I tell, all my friends that are new to the city, to go here because the coffee is better than Starbucks and the vibe is much cooler. Ill be back soon‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

First time trying the hyped ‚ú® Amelia's ‚ú® experience.  First of all, the location is amazing in terms of decor, cleanse, and organization. ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê  The decor allows you to take a lot of great pictures to post on Instagram and so on. üì∏üì∏üì∏üì∏üì∏  The presentation of food is great, where all desserts are looking great and staff is very welcoming in explaining any questions, which is always awesome. ü§åüèºü§åüèºü§åüèºü§åüèº  The coffee was good and the dessert was a solid B . The only aspect that can be approved is price, where 4 items that were ordered summed up to more than $20 which is an average of over $5 per item which is aloot in my opinion. üí≤üí≤üí≤üí≤üí∏üí∏üí∏üí∏  Looking forward to trying Amelia's again. üòé

Love love love Amelie's!  I have been to this location a couple of times. Most recently, we arrived on a Friday evening after attending another event. In addition to wanting dessert, my husband wanted something to eat. There was a sizable line when we arrived. But we knew the food would be well worth the wait!  I was disappointed because they were out of the salted caramel apple cider that I really had my sight set on. So I opted for a chai latte with oat milk. I had a cookie dough macaron and chai latte macaron as well.  My husband had the chicken + pesto + goat cheese sandwich along with the salted caramel brownie layer torte.  I can always count on Amelie's for a consistently great experience!
good

Love that I was greeted when I walked in. Service was excellent. Options were plenty and the food was as delicious as it looks. Plenty of outlets to plug up and work. It's not too loud so you can definitely work comfortably. My favorite Amelie's. Dining outside when the day is nice is just as lovely as inside.
The place feels as prejudice as it did a couple years ago. An associate got mad when I came back just to order a bottle of water‚Ä¶ Lol

(Translated by Google) A great place, with quality coffee and very delicious pastries and a great variety, its staff are very friendly and provide very professional service, the service is very fast, the place is very cozy, invites you to be there with friends or family, in to date I recommend it 100%  A great place, with quality coffee and delicious pastries and a great variety, its staff are very friendly and provide very professional service, the service is very fast, the place is very cozy, it invites you to be there with friends or family, in a appointment, I recommend it 100%  (Original) A great place, with quality coffee and very delicious pastries and a great variety, its staff are very friendly and provide very professional service, the service is very fast, the place is very cozy, invites you to be there with friends or family, in a date . I recommend it 100%  Un grandioso lugar, con cafe de calidad y la reposteria muy riquisima y gran variedad,su staff son muy amigables y atienden muy profesional,el service es muy rapido,el lugar es muy acogedor, invita a estar ahi con amigos o familia,en una cita, yo lo recomiendo al 100%

I really wanted to try the vegan cr√®me br√ªl√©e!  When I asked if they had anything else ‚Äúdairy-free‚Äù the girl helping me then asked one of her coworkers, and her response was, ‚Äúno vegans allowed!‚Äù  I'd go back for the blueberry tea and to sit under the adorable Eiffel Tower, only if this was my last and only option of caf√© in all of Charlotte‚Ä¶

The flakiest, crispiest, butteriest croissant I've ever had. Better than Paris. The atmosphere is energetic and eclectic, but not overwhelming. The staff is friendly and helpful, and everything was clean. 10/10
üëå
Love this location. The atmosphere is very nice and enjoyable. There are so many things to look at and explore in the dining area. The desserts and drinks were fresh and delicious.

Wouldn't recommend the NoDa Amelie's. I've been going to the Park Road/Montford Amelie's for 6 years. I recently moved to NoDa and this one does not compare. It is SUPER slow and there is a difference in quality in the pastries and the way they are presented. The croissants sit out on the counter instead of in the pastry case so when you are waiting in line for 40 minutes and looking at them, it really makes your appetite go away knowing they've been sitting out there since 8am (I'll add a picture for fun). I also don't like that you have to wait in the long line even if you just want a coffee, however I didn't mind at park road Amelie's since it was much quicker and the staff actually knew what they were doing. I am currently writing this as I sit in line (going on 40 min) looking at the gross pastries when all I want is a coffee. I will never stop going to Amelie's but I hope they can improve the NoDa one‚Ä¶
Love this place!! So yummy!! Nice and friendly staff
Prices are higher when placing an online order as shown on the menu listed. There is a price difference.

Stopped in to celebrate Birthdays. It was mine & my niece's first time here, but my sister has been here before. We ordered the Fall Chicken Salad sandwich, original chicken salad, and the Chicken, Goat Cheese and Pesto Sandwich. We also ordered the macaroons (made fresh daily). Everything was enjoyable, healthy portions of chicken salad on each sandwich. However, the chicken salad had a strong mustard flavor. We will definitely come back and try other menu items.

This place it good! As a recent visiter of France, I was looking for a little taste of the motherland and this is pretty close to the real thing! I wasn't super hungry when I showed up, so I didn't want to go to far. I shared with my wife so we could taste a few items. The little chocolate cups with mousse fillings are amazing. We had the raspberry and caramel ones and they were both delicious. We shared a tartine with bacon and fig jam and it was so good. We got the 1/2 tartine, which was a very good size. I got a blueberry cheesecake macron for the heck of it and it was a delicious little treat. The decor is really great and super inviting.  Why they didn't get 5-stars: The asparagus soup could use a little more "umph", there was some flavor missing. The pain au chocolate had good chocolate flavor, but should be a bit more flaky (it was a little dense).
Great and unique ambiance. Diverse options of legit French pastries.
My first time, I will definitely come back. The ambient is peaceful to enjoy a delicious coffee in a good company!
Great place for pastries, coffee, sandwiches and many more items that are delicious and made with great quality
Excellent customer service and superior food I will be going back againüëç
Nothing  but AWESOME!
It was jam packed but well worth the wait.

That's our 2nd time here. What I am understanding is that you don't come here for the food, you come here for the experience. The store is well decorated, well lit and there is a lot to see. They have a huge Eiffel Tower in the corner of the store, super nice. We tried the sweets and the baguette. Go for the baguette with butter. The sweets and sugary, cold and dry. The baguette is perfect, fresh and delicious. 3 ladies gave me a hard time to warm up my sweets but a 4th one gave me new sweets, told me she would warm them but when I got to taste them they were cold. Don't know if will come back again. Definitely a experience
Order ..choose your self sandwich
We live out of town but anytime we are in Charlotte we make it a point to stop in to this cute caf√©. They have the yummiest macaroons ever!

The pastries are good, four stars, but the "hot" food is terrible, zero stars.  I ordered some pastries and a sandwich with turkey, ham, swiss and Dijon mustard. I was told the sandwich is served hot. When I got it, it was mostly mustard, dripping everywhere. I had to use napkins to wipe off the excess gallon of mustard. They toasted the bread and melted the cheese. That's it. The meat was cold. All in all a disgusting sandwich that I took two bites of and threw away.  Go for the pasties and avoid the nasty "hot" food.

Terrible experience here. They got my order wrong, did not apologize for forgetting an entire meal, and on top of that I had my dogs with me in the patio, was served my food, and then after we had already started eating they told me no dogs were allowed outside in the patio. The only sign that says no dogs is next to the door to go inside saying dogs cannot be where kitchens are, aka inside. Very poor customer service which is unfortunate since their food is great.
Amazing place. The food and bakery is delicious. The customer service and atmosphere is just as amazing. Iced coffee is so rich and good. Such a unique decor üòç ‚ú®Ô∏è
Can be a bit pricey, but the quality of the product shines through. Delicious pastries and coffee.
My favorite place to grab sweets. Just so you know Friday , Saturday and Sunday nights the lines get huge so be prepared.

(Translated by Google) Although it is in an industrial sector, there is a relaxing and warm atmosphere, both inside and on the small terrace.  Great coffee! Generous and tasty pastries.  (Original) Malgr√© que c'est dans un secteur industriel, on y retrouve une ambiance relaxante et chaleureuse, aussi bien √† l'int√©rieur que dans la petite terrasse.  Excellent caf√©! P√¢tisseries g√©n√©reuses et go√ªteuses.

Definitely overrated. The pastries look better than they taste.. some were frozen while others were dry. The coffee tasted more like syrup even though I ordered no sweetener. Not worth the line. The macaroons were good though.
Yummy food & unique place
Bonjour Am√©lie! Lovely to see you again and have this tasty breakfast. Croque Monsieur and Macrons galore! üòã I like your new location, I was in Uptown last time I was visiting years ago.

The food is amazing. Service was incredible given the fact their system was down. A+ to them because there were alot of Karen's being rude and they kept their cool and handled everything awesomely.  Sorry about all the Karen's I personally was pleased with your service.
Better atmosphere than the old NODA location. Great atmosphere,  fantastic selections.
Absolutely fantastic. The decor is so fun, the pastries and baked goods are beautiful and delicious and the food off the menu is excellent. The staff was helpful and kind. It was a perfect brunch.

The manager Lona ( really hope remembered it right) was so amazingly welcoming ! The macaroons are perfect, the Pumpkin Chai Latte is my cup of tea. All the sweet and savory lovers ! The fig bacon and Brie cheese open face sandwich is chefs kiss

Adorable French bakery with so many options! The croissant breakfast sandwich was so good, flaky, buttery, yum! The macaroons were huge and also really good - loved the blueberry cheesecake in particular. What could have been better was the wait time. It took about 15 minutes to get a black coffee, which was way too long. I would go back, but maybe not a Sunday morning.

Interesting interior. However food was very underwhelming. Ordered a build your own sandwich, and while the baguette was fresh the rest of the ingredients (egg, avocado and  tomato) were not of the best quality.
I love Amelie's! I was sad when they shut down their original NODA location but this new one place it out the water. Such a cute spot and always enjoy their desserts.
Amazing pastries with great decor!

Beautiful building inside and out. Food was absolutely wonderful. I had the Am'elie's Chicken Salad on a croissant with asparagus soup as a side. Everything was freshly made...I will be going backüëçüëç
Will not return they make you wait in the mainline to order beverages‚Ä¶.. 20 mins later I placed my order for a sweet tea‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶

Building is really cool, feels like you're in France! My cr√®me br√ªl√©e was delicious, my husband enjoyed his breakfast sandwich although the French toast was bland, would recommend people to come in!
Super cute place, great vibe. I did not taste the pastries but those with me said theirs was yummy!!
Desserts are fantastic and coffee was robust! We drive out of our way to come here. Give yourself time to let the desserts come to room temperature for the greatest flavors.
Was in town on business for lunch.  I had a delicious cup of Amelie's Spinach Asparagus Leek soup. It was Yummy!

Authentic French Breads and confectionery with an Ambiance to match.  Wide varieties of food items (vegan also) and drinks. A very courteous and helpful staff. Lots of parking place adds to the leisurely enjoying the evening. A must visit if you are in Charlotte.
Nice bakery with good food and drink options.
Beautiful Bakery!! Felt like I travel to France!! Everyone must try!! Coffee was awesome too!!
The best croissant I have eaten since my trip to France years ago. Will make you cry happy, yummy tears!

This place is just so unique inside, it's a ‚Äúmust see‚Äù. Your eyes will be captivated by all the neat art hanging on the walls and the very cool light fixtures. Plenty of space for a large group of friends to meet and also a separate room to rent for parties. Now, let's talk the coffee & food‚Ä¶delicious! I got the Pecan Peach Salmon Salad, absolutely tasty. Friend got some soup. I got an iced oat latte sweetened with honey, it was perfection. Can't wait to go back and try some other tasty desserts.

I recently started eating croissants. We got the almond croissant and chocolate croissant. THAT ALMOND CROISSANT IS THE BEST CROISSANT I've ever tasted. The chocolate one was delicious too, but you have to try the almond one. Both croissants were perfectly flakey yet soft. I would give 10 stars if I could. Please always have the almond croissants!!!
Love the new location. Can't wait to go back.
We Love Amelie's for the food, treats and atmosphere. üá´üá∑üçÆüç∞üåà
Excellent friendly service

If you want to go to Paris on a budget, this is the place to go. They have a good amount of parking available in their parking lot. The decorations are lively and creative. It's spacious inside. Friendly staff. A lot of dessert options and they were fresh. I would definitely try them again when I'm in the area.
Truly authentic!! I'll visit this place once a week :)
This place is so good! It's one of my nEw favorites. They have some delicious deserts, breakfast, and lunch. Love the vibes of this place. Get there!
Everything I tried here was delicious!

Been a favorite of mine years ago and since I was in college. Many memories from the old spot when they were 24 hours late night coffee and writing papers. Desserts are always amazing. My favorites are salted caramel brownies and espresso entremets when they're in season. Iced mocha is really good too. Love this place
Great atmosphere Cafe with unique artistic style with plenty of French breakfast sandwiches and soups. Don't forget dessert!
Amelies moved to a bigger spot to be as slow as they used to be. SPEED UP YOUR LINES!

4 stars because the coffee i got wasn't so great, but that's probably because i didn't put the right stuff in it, so i'll give it another chance and put something different in my coffee next time. anyways, yesterday was my first time going there with a friend I met up with for the first time as well. I asked them what kind of sweeteners they have and he was talking so fast it was hard to keep up. his name was Anthony. but other than my bad experience with the coffee for my first time there, the macarons were really good! i tried the cotton candy (10/10), the peaches and cream (10/10), the watermelon (8.5/10) and orange (2/10). Cotton candy has always been my favorite ice cream flavor from cold stone. the shop was adorable, i absolutely loved every decoration they had. i would definitely come back, even though i had 1 bad experience, but a good one as well. I've never been to a place like this before so it was definitely a great experience.

Went for breakfast and coffee on a Friday late morning. It was quite busy (be prepared to wait in line) but the employees were great and moved things along as fast as possible. Did not have to wait very long for my drink or food to be prepared after ordering and had no trouble finding a place to sit. Cute ambiance as well.
Go back to 24hrs‚Ä¶.The night owls ü¶â miss it.

Great place but needs to allow you to fill up your own mugs on togo orders.  Lots of mornings I just want coffee on the go and don't want to drink out of micro plastics coated disposable cups.  Are you really being safer by not letting me fill up my own mug?  On such mornings I just go to the rhino market.  Behind the times on that one.  Thanks.  Also get a nice pinot noir wine please.

I would have given a 5 rating but I didn't since they were out of two items that I ordered five days in advance for. The associate that assisted me gave me a complimentary item for my inconvenience, so that's a plus. I love the decor inside along with the fancy takeout.
Love the new Noda location, so big lots of parking. Awesome job.
Amazing !!! Love everything
Love love love the new location. :-) Great atmosphere wonderful desserts and impeccable customer service. :-)
The food is fresh with a lot of desert variety
Soooo-soo yummy! Interior is so cute.Yes, I recommend this place.

My bread pudding was absurdly dry the person didn't even know had ordered it, walking around asking people if it was theirs and I waited forever for my tartine while people around me showed up much later got their food. The server came over and asked if I had gotten my food because I was waited so long. Irritated I waited 35 minutes for brie and bacon to be added to toast.
Had a peach tart and a cotton candy macaroon with a raspberry lemonade. The perfect place to go for a midnight treat.
Same French cafe food and drink standards and eclectic decor served in a new space. There's a partially covered patio with a few tables on the side of the building.
Love how convenient this location is as well as the friendly staff
I had a danish and fruit tart and they were both really bland. The coffee is alright. Overall too overpriced
Chocolate croissants were ok, but nothing too special. Whenever we pass by next time, we will need to try something else to see if it is better based off the other reviews given.
It used to be absolute must in Charlotte... now with new location and rude stuff also next to none selection... no thank you!
It's was ok. The macarons were soft, soggy, and stale this go round. It's like the made them days ago. I won't be going back to this location.
The best office, food and service!!!!!

I love this place! Every time I come to Charlotte I HAVE to come here. Their asparagus leek soup is to DIE FOR! If anyone knows the recipe I will pay handsomely. We were helped by Thomas who was so kind and attentive, we chatted about the virtues of even numbers, and generally had the best time. I love this place- always 5 stars.
So delicious! The ladies working the counter were all friendly and helpful. The decor was adorable! Would definitely recommend
Nice place. A little bit of snag with customer service. Still nice, clean, comfortable for family or date. A few people wear make...most do not. There are space to sit outside. Enjoy. peace
macarons were really good, all the other options were so bad. don't go here unless you're getting macarons
The place is awesome. Great sweets and coffee. Some of the typical dishes such as croque monsieur we're not good.  Please, work on specialties from France.  Merci
(Translated by Google) Good decoration and attention!  (Original) Buena decoraci√≥n y atenci√≥n !

Beautiful decor. Went earlier in the day so it was quiet empty. Have a great selection of gluten-free goods including GF bread, macaroons, tea cakes, brownies, and creme brulee. The coffee section offered lactose-free milk options too. I can't wait to stop by again on my next trip through.

Went there for the first time and last time. Went there to grab food to go with my emotional support dog (small dog). I was carrying him. A worker came up to me and asked if my dog was a service dog and I told him he's an ESA and we're just grabbing to go and he said it's fine. He was friendly. We ordered everything and while we were waiting for our last item this other worker from behind the counter basically kicked me out because of my dog, even after I told him that I a spoke to someone else and they said it was ok he still said ‚ÄúI need the dog to be outside‚Äù So basically go wait outside in 100 degree weather because I'm carrying a tiny dog that's not bothering anyone or touching anything.  Now let's talk food. We ordered a sandwich and 2 pastries. Everything is way over priced for what you get. The baguette sandwich was so tiny and not worth the 8.50. I've lived in Paris for 4 years and have had plenty of bigger baguette sandwiches for 5$! The lemon tart or tarte au citron tasted horrible! It did not taste like a lemon tart at all! Other pastries were named wrong as well like the chocolate croissant which is actually called pain au chocolat. If you want to have a fake/knock off Paris experience than go check it out. If you want the real deal than this is not the place.
We absolutely LOVE!! this place....we had coffee and pastries....very tasty..beautiful decor...Manager Allana...very helpful and nice...Place to check out !!

Love the new Amelie's. Such a pretty and welcoming space. I had a cookie dough macaron, a Napoleon and a petit gateaux. Everything was absolutely fresh and delicious. I also had an iced coffee with oat milk and that was really great too. The service was really great. Everyone was really patient explaining what everything was. I'll definitely go back and try other sweets. Loved their French bulldog decor too!!!
Best macaroons I've had in North Carolina!

The new location is so much bigger I love it!  Always enjoy their iced mocha because it is more dark and dry.  The fruit tarts are my favorite pastry.  Amelie's is always going to be one of my favorite places in Charlotte.
This place is gorgeous inside! Comfy chairs plenty of room to work and enjoy baked goods and coffee!

This place offers a great selection of pastries and coffee. The staff was patient and knowledgeable. We had several pastries and each was delicious. The dining area is comfortable and filled with an entertaining decor.

Cafe latte, Salted Caramel brownie and Mini Caramel tarts were amazing. The subtle caramel really hit the spot. However, the Macarons were too sweet. My sweet threshold is greater than a lot of people and even I found these Macarons (Blueberry Cheesecake and Cafe Au Lait) too sweet.
I really like the place and it would be better if it went back to be 24hrs open.
Every time we are in Charlotte we have brunch at Amelie's.  The food and drinks are consistently delicious! Alana took care of us this visit and she's great.

I cannot say enough great things about Am√©lie's French Bakery & Caf√©. Shanna happily greets me by name every visit, and she never fails to make my morning bright! Jo, the barista, is an angel! I appreciate them more than they know. The atmosphere, the coffee, the food, and the staff are all incredible. Check it out!

Of course, I understand that no one will respond to this comment.But I will write this.We often come to this cafe.At least 7 people work in each shift.I still don't understand why everyone has been doing this for so long.Sometimes it happened that I waited for the usual coffee for 35 minutes, despite the fact that I make an order in advance.This time there were the same number of people on shift, we made an order for food and drinks.It seems to me that employees come to work only to talk, but not to work in any way.I ordered a dish from the refrigerator, which just needs to be pulled out and served to me.I decided to approach the employee, ask her to serve me a dish right away, to which she agreed and continued the conversation with her colleagues, very slowly putting on gloves.Then I said, just give me this dish and I'll eat it now.To which she began to mock me, said that I would wait!Because she's busy!After talking to his colleague.It's just disgusting and unpleasant.After that, she went to complain about us to her manager, who approached us and told us to leave the establishment.Because of what?because we were unhappy with the fact that we had been waiting for the order for so long, and began to be indignant.Of course, I understand, America and no one cares about anything.But not by the same amount.We are not going to visit this institution anymore, and I do not advise anyone.I still don't understand why there are so many outstanding reviews here.Thanks, morning is ruined!
I LOVE your new space. My Only suggestion is to display the different  kinds of soups you have. I love your soups and I miss being  able to see what they are.
Eclectic decor, great coffee and easy ambiance! Pastries are ok, as the quality does not compare to that of real French patisseries.
Alana is the best!

EDIT: it's no longer open 24hrs unfortunately!  only 24hr coffee shop I've ever known of! I like to come here on thanksgiving after a turkey trot, late nights after a concert, or just to do some work during the day. EVERY baked good is amazing; macaroons on point; meals are great; coffee is amazing- my favorite cappuccino in town and the french press is amazing too;
Awesome place! Good food and coffee and quirky items everywhere. Very cool ambience!

(Translated by Google) The taste was actually just that. Both the croissant sandwich and the macaron coffee are flat..(?) It's more of an American style than a French style. The interior is not very busy, but the interesting thing is that it comes out pretty when you take a picture. One of the cutest most adorable bakeries. Love the ambiance and the decor. All the items I have tried so far have been absolutely delicious. üòã

Love the new place. Decorated very nicely, but it's sad that after I pay $16 for sweets plus tip that employees wanted to comment under their breathe when I asked for a box/bag with Amelie's written on it (was given a plain white box and they had the blue boxes in stock in eye sight right  behind the counter ).This was part of a gift for my mom's retirement. I got the blue boxes, but only after first being told they ‚Äúdidn't have them‚Äù. Way to make a customer feel bad just for asking for some cardboard.

All I can say is OMG they have outdone themselves with the new locations. It is so well designed and the space is AMAZING!!  The pastries and drinks ( coffee/tea/ French sodas) just everything about this place is to die for ‚ù§Ô∏è this is my go too with my bestie, my fianc√© and anyone I can drag with me üòÇ be prepared to just order everything, because the options are great and everything looks and tastes sooo good. I usually get the vanilla eclairs, a Paris latte and I also have had the crustless quiche and omggggg it melts in your mouth. Please gooooo‚Ä¶‚Ä¶ run there now and thank me later üòâ üòÇ

New NoDa location is gorgeous and open and sunny with plenty of on site parking. Alaina was managing the front of house and she did a wonderful job of checking in on us and making sure we had everything we needed.
It is decent but way overpriced for what you get.. and they love using plastic, just plastic everything if you get togo.
If you want a pinch or disney magic, but can't get to Orlando, try this bakery. It's adorable.  The staff is friendly and courteous. The food is great!

Love the late night trips to enjoy sudden cravings.  The new location looks stunning. The whole vibe has changed. It's just amazing. They have reduced their hours unfortunately üò≠. But the food remains impeccable as always.
I've been coming here since I was a kid, and I still love the turkey bacon croissant

Loved my visit to Alelie's today! Savannah took GREAT care of us and we are loving what we are about to indulge in. The back patio seating area has a realxing water feature and many beautiful potted plants. We didn't have any sandwiches today but the ones I saw come out of the kitchen looked great.

Great spot for desserts. Known for their salted caramel brownies so we had to try them and it definitely didn't disappoint. Really good! We also got some of their other desserts and it was delicious. Just the right amount of sweetness . Highly recommend for your sweet cravings.
New location is REALLY nice.  I thought I'd miss the old one but this is just as good, more parking and space just less convenient to get to for me
Amazing pastries, salads and coffee. üòÅ

The first thing you'll notice here is an incredible ambiance of paintings and eccentric furnishings with wild and wacky chandeliers. I doubt any two tables were the same. Approaching the ordering area one may be overwhelmed by the variety of what one might at first glance believe to be a casual and small cafe experience but this bakery/cafe is here to impress. The service of their upbeat and cheerful employees will make quick work of helping you make a delicious decision. For my meal I enjoyed a delectable marriage of chicken, goat cheese spread, spinach, and sun dried tomato aioli on a beautiful baguette style bread. The flavors practically danced on my tongue to a symphony played out by whatever gorgeous blend of spices they marinaded their chicken in. This is not to sell short the delicious stew of chicken, sausage, beans, corn, and onion with an almost Greek tasting blend of spices mixed in that I ordered with my sandwich. Their macarons were masterfully crafted in the traditional manner and their chocolate creme brulee did not disappoint. All in all, there is undoubtedly no reason to skip visiting Am√©lie's so long as you're in Charlotte within their operating hours.
Excellent cookies
Visiting from out of town.  This place is literally perfect in every way! The decor is amazing, food was delicious, the staff friendly, coffee fabulous, and bathrooms fantastic!! 5 ü§©

So many people work here...and yet if you get anything to go (not from case) it takes forever while employees check phones, drink coffee, and casually work. I've been once for overnight oats and another time for quiche --both made ahead of time and have 10-15min waiting.  If you are just picking up....expect to wait. I like coming here because I can walk but why is it so difficult for the kitchen to fill a cup or slice a pre-made without being checked on?
The service was really nice, but they only offer one vegan dessert? Seriously? It's 2022. Edit: The vegan creme br√ªl√©e is really bad :(

My visit to this place was pretty disappointing. The staff is unprofessional. The prices are unreasonably high. What can you say, it's a chain, and no one really cares whether or not a customer is happy.
The employees at this place are absolutely ridiculous and rude. Sadly they ruin the whole experience.

(Translated by Google) Delicious desserts and hot and cold drinks. The place beautifully decorated. Definitely a unique place  (Original) Deliciosos postres y bebidas fr√≠as y calientes. El lugar decorado hermoso. Sin duda un lugar √∫nico
Really pretty in here. But the AC is too cold to work here for long.
Food was great but there were no parking spaces available so had to wait for someone to come out and line was long inside
Amazing sweet place!! Difficult to choose ü§£ü§£ü§£   You never disappoints if you come here

Love the new location! Food is much better in my opinion. Staff is really friendly and the decor is so eclectic and eye catching. Great spot for meetings, brunch or a change in scenery for those who work from home. I was impressed. Definitely check it out if you're in NoDa
Love the strawberry cake

I used to go to the other location in Noda years ago, loved it. Visited their new location on 36th and it was like a completely different place. Bright lights, generic decorations, and it has absolutely no soul like the former. Feels like a mix between McDonald's and an airport food court.
So many wonderful things to look at!
The chocolate croissant was magnefique!!!

(Translated by Google) Rich food excellent attention 100% American I loved it for the first time but I will return.  (Original) Rica comida exelente atenci√≥n 100% Americano me encanto minprimer vez pero regresar√©.
My latte was awful, they need to invest in better beans.

Went to check out the new location and was disappointed - but not surprised - to see that it had been created in the same corporate kitsch as the other locations. Granted, they needed more space, but they managed to complete clear out the uniqueness and coziness that made my friends and I recommend "Amelie's - the real one on NoDa, not the uptown location" to newcomers to Charlotte. If I wanted to eat macaroons in a grocery store ambience, I'd simply go to Publix down the street (and frankly, Publix' macaroons are better). And now I see that this location closes at 10:00pm every night (which is even earlier than weekends at the Rock Hill location) so going there to sober up after a night on the town is out of the question now. I don't know how the owners of a business could be so clueless as to why their place of establishment was popular in the first place
I Love the new location it makes you want to sit in for sure an its closer
Good chicken and sausage soup and great deserts....beautiful business very photographic.
New location! Same great pastries, coffee and more. The decor is just beautiful! Service was wonderful!

I really appreciate Amelie's late hours. I wish more places opened late in Charlotte. Their pastries are good although a bit overpriced. Love the large dining room...but they could make it less bright, feels like cafeteria lighting.  When we went there was only ONE person helping people with pastries and another person who is standing idly waiting to ring people up. The line is ridiculously slow.
Always a joy to eat at Amalie's. Fresh, delicious food served with a smile. And the pastries!!! Oh my.

If I could give 6/5 stars, I would! This place was amazing, from the food to the staff to the interior design, everything. We had the croque monsieur, the strawberry petit g√¢teau, and the salted caramel brownie, and they were all outstanding.

Ordered a cappuccino & a napoleon, coffee was basic(cheap beans) and the napoleon wasn't good either. Very disappointing, if you want a good napoleon go to LA renaissance patisserie in South Park, so much better!

I loved the original location - I had been going there for about 10 years. It was fun, cozy, and cool. The new location feels like a cafeteria. They obviously tried to capture the magic of the original, but the authentic quirkiness has been replaced with a corporate, manufactured quality. It's almost like a Disneyland version of the original. But what else can you expect in Charlotte? Some people may enjoy this vibe but if you liked the style of their OG location I can almost guarantee you will feel put off.  Food is still good, service is still friendly, but other than that... This was a mistake.

(Translated by Google) It is top quality confectionery with a number of desserts with a high quality waiting room  (Original) Es respoter√≠a de primera calidad con un sin n√∫mero de postres con un sal√≥n de espera de alta calidad
The best place in Charlotte!

The food and pastries are delicious like always, and the new spot is beautiful, but unbelievably slow. The line is wrapped around the perimeter of the dining area, there are twice as many people waiting in line than sitting, and food is crawling out of the kitchen. I don't know if they're understaffed or disorganized, but it's a little too chaotic. Hope they get it fixed, I love coming here.
Got really sick. So did everyone else that ate with me. Maybe a bad batch, but the place was filthy.
Just visited the new location....AMAZING
Love the new storeüåûand Allana really makes our visits here extra special the pastries are the best!!
Not much of a fan of the sandwiches but the sweets are fantastic.

Wow really disappointed in the new location -  gone is the quirky charm only to be replaced by a decor that reminds me of a theme restaurant at a floating river casino in Oklahoma.  Also gone is service - from time in line to completing our meals 1hour 30  minutes.  That's a lot for a quiche and coffee.  Hard to point and order your favorite treat in the display case as you place your order before you get there - so be sure you know the name of your sweet delight before you get to register.  They were out of figs, Brie, bacon, cream, etc (the French would be appalled!). Sorry Amelie's, loved you at the old location but won't be coming back to the new industrial digs.

Jaden has the best Customer Service!!!! Got everything I wanted quick and with no hesitation! Even complimented my shirt and gave me a nickname!!! Not to mention that the Desserts were phenomenal! Spot on every flavor of Macaroons and amazing Pecan Pie!!!
Very, very Slowwww!!!!!
Such a memorable experience! Makes you truly think you are in Paris! A tremendous amount of adversity!
I think it's very cute. It's in a nice area and the staff is friendly and welcoming, they're  so sweet. I'd definitely visit here again.
Good stuff üòåüëç

Adorable French bakery and cafe. Definitely come for the pastries and coffee. The fruit tarts and eclairs are especially delicious. It was hard to pick just one! If you like macrons, then this is the place for you. They have at lease a dozen flavors. The whole atmosphere of the place is wonderful as well. Would be a great spot to sit and read a book for hours.

Always the best! We over order and over eat because we can't decide on just one thing! Fantastic bakery items as well as soup, salad, sandwiches, appetizers, unique coffee/espresso drinks, the list goes on! Whenever we are in the area we make it a point to make a stop at Am√©lie's.

Got in on a landmark before that location closes and they relocate..down the street. As always a line.. But it moves quickly, cashiers were nice. Place is clean and spaced out.  Tried the Chicken Pesto & Goat Cheese Sandwich..delish.  Will try new location once the newness wears off. Not a fan of crowds. But treat yourself..they have so many options for dessert, coffees & teas.
We just moved to Charlotte and the first place we visited was this bakery!!! It serves variety of different yummy options and also has great interiors
Lovely place to study, grab coffee and dessert and chat. One of my favorite cafes in Charlotte
Had a great brunch here! Food was fresh and the desserts were both beautiful and delicious! Staff was also super friendly. Best bakery I've been to in nc. We'll definitely be back!

Thomas! WOW!!!! The best service I have EVER experienced; me and my Divine partner Giles‚Äî went here for the first time; they were super receptive; had great conversations, told us about the new location and had such a warm loving energy! They should be the face of the company! Put them in in charge if they arin't already,. Very much so comforting / welcoming energy- FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE! Will be sharing this location to loving people; we are out in Athens, and really wish this location was closer! We would be ongoing customers! - thank you so much Thomas! Fantastic experience! Me and my partner Hope to see you soon ! - much love , oh! And the food is PHENOMENA L:-)
The tarts were beautiful and all our treats were delicious. The staff were so helpful and kind.
Great dessert spot.  It gets a bit crowded some nights.

I love this place‚Ä¶ But the macarons are not as tasty as the used to..  After buying a dozen to share with friends - we could not even tell which flavor was which (with the exception of chocolate and vanilla) ‚Ä¶.We were soooo disappointed! The macarons could definitely use more essence/flavor!!!

Great place to go study or just spend time with your friends. I went there because it was recommended by a local. The decorations where unique and the customer service was friendly. Definitely will be back again.  Update - Still a great place to get some coffee and a pastry. Took some family from out of town and they loved the place.

Never visit this place when you're in a hurry. You'll want to savor the moment. From the interior to the people watch, not to mention the deliciousness behind the counter. Went at an off time. Was still about 20 in line but it moved quickly. Love that it's 24 hours too. Artsy funky eclectic and tasty treats
Love this place the food always  delicious will go back again. Its is my favorite place to meet up and to just relax
We enjoyed  the experience so much! The food, service, and staff were professional.  Allana was also so kind, warm, remembered us, and personable.  Thanks,  From "us!"
Always a pleasant visit!!

I will be reviewing the good and the bad while comparing my experience here with my visit to Vilani's Bakery.  The good: -I enjoyed their macarons better than Vilani's. Particularly the cotton candy -Nice atmosphere  The bad: -Expensive, I was able to get more for less at Vilani's -Their key lime pie was too tart for me while Vilani's was great -Lemon pastry was also too tart while Vilani's lemon bar is very good -Their take on bread pudding was dry and unflavorful -The creme brulee drink they had was pretty awful
The best pecan pie tarts on earth. Thank you! Plus the blueberrie muffins are perfect! They come with pie crumble on top. Never disappointed with this place.
Lovely place. Amazing and creative desserts.
Petit Chocolate Gateaux is one of the best things I have ever eaten.

(Translated by Google) For customer service, responsibility to deliver orders and the rich flavor of the bakery  (Original) Por la atencion al cliente la Responsabilidad para entregar los pedidos y el Rico sabor de la panaderia
Love the aesthetic!! So unique and has all you need with pastry. Staff are friendly.

I cannot say enough great things about this place!!! My wife has celiac and they had GREAT gluten free pastry options! We tried one of each flavor of their macaroons and they were simply incredible! We also tried a latte and a lemonade. Both drinks were exceptional! Long story short, if you are anywhere near NoDa, give this place a try!

AMAZING!!! Staff was so kind. They helped us decide what to get. They recommended all the macaroons and any type of croissants. I got the pistachio macaroon and cinnamon twist and they both were amazing. Also tried the chicken salad sandwich and it was fantastic.
Alana is the best ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è You are just amazing ü§©

The food was good and overall the service was ok. I need to give a shout out to Allana who, when we were celebrating a birthday, came through with a lighter when nobody else in the staff would. She really saved the day!
The food was great and the staff was even better! Shout out to Allana for providing the best service!
Lovely cafe and great pastry üòãüòã Get ready for a long line to order at weekends!

I liked the first iced coffee but that's all. The second iced coffee was completely different with some "oat milk" that was clumpy and settled on the bottom of my cup like sludge. It wouldn't mix into the drink which tasted really bad. If that was all then I wouldn't be writing this review, but the pastries were also sub grocery store quality.  Again, I wouldn't have let that lead to a one star review. Just because the mirror tart was a very thick crust with essentially stale buttercream frosting on top and my second iced coffee was thrown out because of it's consistency and taste doesn't equal a one star review. We all have off days.  It was the chicken salad sandwich. Raising it to my mouth I had a momentary thought of "wait why does this look and smell like a tuna sandwich?" But I was very hungry so I went with choosing trust in the Restaurant over my senses. Immediately I felt a slight gag reflex, like my body didn't want to swallow what I was chewing. It tasted off, is the best way to put it, and definitely not like chicken salad.  Well I ate most of the sandwich before choking a bit on a large chicken bone and that was just my limit. Well plus the building sense of nausea, so I left to finish errands.  About ten to fifteen minutes later I'd made it to grocery shopping and ended up vomiting in the urinal after almost throwing up into a plugged nasty toilet but catching myself last second. While vomiting into that urinal and then feeling really unwell for the next day I did regret eating at this "French" bakery.  I wouldn't recommend eating or drinking here.

Today was my first time at Am√©lie's French Bakery, and I know for a fact it won't be my last.  From the moment I walked in, I was excited. There were so many delights to choose from, from tarts to macaroons and macarons, and so much more. The service was great and the staff was more than willing to describe flavors and help pick new favorites.  Each dessert was light, perfectly crunchy and pack with a perfect sweetness. If you're in NODA and in need of a sweet treat, check them out!

Amelie's is much more than pastries and dessert's. Their spinach asparagus soup and mandarin and goat cheese salad is my favorite lunch. I always add salmon for extra protein. Their food is made fresh daily and exceptional!

Absolutely beautiful interior, tons of delicious options, and very friendly workers. Would definitely recommend if you're passing by. The selection of macaroons is huge, and I loved the cotton candy flavor.

Don't let them replace your old gift card by a new one 3 weeks ago they informed me that they must replace my old gift card by a new one and today they informed me that  my new card was never activated and worth zero $ . Plus the bad attitude of the manager plus it's not a real French pastry quality specially for a client like me who lived in France. I will never go back .
SO GOOD! 10/10 recommend - interior was so cute - food was delicious - so many sweet options in bakery - staff was happy, attentive, nice, energetic and funny

This is the go to spot for macarons and other French pastries. They have the best macaroons ns I have ever tasted. Always fresh and flavorful.  I also enjoy their coffee they have a small selection but it's a great selection. The flavor of their coffee is delicious üòã.  Their decorations are also a sight to be seen. I realized a chandelier can be made out of anything.
Tasty chai

Beware if you have allergies or dietary restrictions. I ordered a sandwich with some customizations (e.g., gluten free bread) to avoid my allergies and the sandwich came out as it was on the menu. Unfortunately, the order was to-go and on the ticket it looked correct so they weren't given the opportunity to correct the issue immediately. Some training of kitchen staff might be needed to avoid a repeat.  Super long line to order that moved slowly with only one person working the cash register for Sunday lunch time.  On the other hand, my husband said his sandwich was really good.
Great atmosphere, just wish the service was way faster.
I really miss them being open 24 hours.
Great coffee Mike is a great guy
Wonderful pastry. My favorite drink its their Chai tee. It is a good place to meet with friends, clients or study.

For a real good bakery, I was NOT impressed with their Birthday cakes. It was a vanilla and strawberry cake, but did not have a good flavor. The vanilla icing tasted like absolutely nothing. It was also about half the cake. There was an inch and a half icing surrounding the cake as well as within the lakes in 3 layers. The strawberry mixed into the cake was the only good part of the cake. Also‚Ä¶ they need better employees. Some are super friendly, however one of them flat out lied saying that we didn't say there was a nut allergy. We know for a FACT we said it so that employee straight out lied to their manager and their manager did not believe us. Overall, you can go there for macaroons, pastry, or sandwich. However, I do NOT recommend for a cake.
Such a wonderful treat with friendly staff. They take covid seriously, and I love it.
Beautiful place to come in and work on your project and drink a coffe have a meeting

I feel like this whole establishment is falling apart when it comes to common sense an proper measuring. The contradictions and the staffs customer servicing alone is one to spoil a veterans (over 5yrs)experience. You have A dysfunctional team an weak management. When I asked one of the managers what sense does it make for the incompetence that he took place in front of me he told me I was absolutely right and still sent me out the door. I've been coming here for years and it's not ever been this dysfunctional. You have one person eating behind the counter a handful of customers without mask. And then you have another handful of people with mask Partially on. I will never participate in their mask ritual I will never participate in there an Orthodox servicing I guess you just outgrow things.. The best thing they could possibly have are the fruit tarts but they have some of the most awful cr√®me br√ªl√©e I've ever had in my life. Most of the macaroons taste the same.

I love the vibe of the place . There is great customer service and usually when I come to this location, it is packed 7-8pm but they know how to make sure the waiting time isnt alot. Everyone who works there is polite and great. I remember one time I came here . And someone did not want to put a mask and started attacking the worker who kindly asked her to put the mask on . And the worker just said a polite response and ignored the negativity afterwards. They have signs on the door and even have masks & sanitizer available if you dont have one which is a great detail. The indoor and outside dining area are comfortable as well.
Worst experience ever! Theses people were so rude to us about a mask! Unbelievable where this world has came too! What is a mask going to do for you?‚Ä¶ nothing it's a piece of cloth!!!

Went on a busy Sunday morning and had to wait in line but it moved quickly, the hospitality was great, friendly service. I'm coming back for sure because the pastries were amazing and the food was excellent.
The very best in town. I drive 50 miles to get large chocolate mousse cups. The best

Delicious!! Really nice place for tasty desserts. It's great if you want light breakfast Sandwiches with a cup of coffee. Build your own sandwich is a great option they have. Try the mixed berry, the key lime tarts, and espresso entremet This place is also great for photographers. Literally every corner is different and unique in decoration People there are polite and helpful. Jay is super nice
Amazing pastries and delicious quiche‚Ä¶..but you have to come to see Alana! She is a bright light and a joy to start the day. She made my first visit to Amelie's so special. Thank you Alana!!!!
Marvelous selection of French pastries. Very popular place.
I really enjoyed the coffee there

It's rather overpriced and of rather poor quality. The coffee was weak, the quiche tasted ok but was also a bit overcooked and dry, the tartine was under the broiler too long (hard toasted bread and bacon that had that overdone taste from being reheated too long), but the chocolate croissant was acceptable.  It is clearly also a very unsafe and overbearing environment operated by members of the Religion of Masks that dictates you wear their expression of faith and participate in their rituals of wearing a face covering while standing in lines, and then not wearing them while sitting. It's an odd practice and a strange culture to someone from a place where there are no establishments of the Religion of Masks.  I even had one of their young converts approach me and inquire if I had a mask in order to participate in their ritual. I did not intend on joining their controlling cult, since I was unaware the bakery was run by the Church of the Mask and I don't like others impose their faiths on me, I did however oblige the request to participate in their mask ritual since I was in their temple or whatever they call the places for worshipping the masks.  It gives you the creeps though as you look around at the cult of the muzzled people. Reminds me of Orwell's Animal Farm, they even boiled all the past complex and contradictory rules and rituals down for the simple minded, with a request to ‚Äúplease wear a mask‚Äù, with a small little passive-aggressive subscript of ‚Äúit is required in the building‚Äù ‚Ä¶ it may as well have read ‚ÄúMask people good, no mask people bad‚Äù.
Ridiculously slow service. Literally waited 30 mins for some quiche. They are very short staffed and overcrowded. Also, croissants are stale and rock hard

This is one of the favorite places for us in Charlotte. It's one of those places that no matter what you say about it, you won't be able to describe how nice it is. It sure feels like you are in Paris. The coffee is great and really anything you pick from the showcase tastes excellent. Oh and they open 24hrs.

I really love the macs for valentines. And Allana the Mod has the best customer service I have ever seen she makes you feel like family. We are Regulars and enjoy coming to experience the family Atmosphere. She makes us feel right at home.
good dessert!! but the employee was rude, pushy, and rushing us. also masks are still required...

Lemon raspberry tart was flavorless & chocolate eclair had only a small glob of filling to cover the piping hole. Croissant was only redeeming item we purchased‚Äîbuttery, flaky, flavorful. Overall disappointing visit, won't return.

You're behind a plastic shield. Masks are not necessary when I'm ordering from you, especially considering I'm standing like 7 feet away. Won't be coming back, won't be recommending to other people. And believe me, plenty of actual nurses will not be coming in.  Also, the coffee wasn't very good anyways.
Never disappoints! Their fruit tarts are perfect each time and their coffee is delicious. I tried their croque monsieur today and it was divine. Just go it's so so worth it!!

Rating the experience not on the quality of the food but on the service. I was asked to leave the store as I didn't have a mask with me (forgot at home). 6-8 other customers were in the store without a mask and nothing was said to them. People were on zoom calls in the cafe section with no mask on also. The restaurant had no masks to offer customers. Gentleman behind the counter was rudely sharp and unwilling to take an order and told me to leave the store. Dissapointted to say the least.

I love this place! The coffee, desserts, atmosphere. I just wish that it was the same as before covid. This definitely used to be my safe place as a college student. Always upbeat and a place to meet friends or study. Kinda wish I was back in college to stay up all night here once again. I will definitely stop by and take it in every time I'm back in town. Love this place and the memories with it.

I came an hour after opening, and they didn't have anything ready. Came at 8am and they had one pastry. It was good, but I made this a main stop on my cross country roadtrip to LA. The man taking my order seemed like he didn't want to be there and went on to mess up my order as well.

I consistently have great experiences here  The pastries are top notch but so is the food and hot beverage menu. I think the prices are good for the value despite what other reviewers have noted. Macarons are a tricky item to perfect, so the price is fair imo. French pastry is a specialty, it's not going to be the same price as your local grocery store bakery. The sandwiches are actually better priced than many other delis I've tried in Charlotte. The drinks are about the same as other independent coffee shops.  I also don't understand the reviews mentioning lack of options. The case is always well stocked no matter when I go. Maybe I'm just easy to please after experiencing the French bakery in Memphis that had maybe a 3 baguettes and 2 eclairs if you went after 2pm.  The decor is unique and fits the theme well. I like that there is plenty of seating
Birthday cake was amazing. Thank you!
It was a bit expensive for what it was. They have some unique drinks and their macarons were well made, but it was over priced in my opnion.

1/7/2020 Homemade Yogurt, Ham & Gruyere Tartine, Mini Chocolate Raspberry Mousse, Chocolate Croissant, Strawberry Cream Cheese Danish, Salted Caramel Brownie- You have to go here NOW! AMAZING! Napoleon! Tonight we went again...more photos from after Queen concert. Yummy- 8/24/19. Open 24 hours. We were there at 1240am. It was packed. 1/6/2022 Still one of my favorite places to celebrate and eat with family and friends.
A must when in Charlotte! We had their sandwiches, soup, and pastries. Coffee is also very good! We ordered a macaron cake for a family get together and it was delicious!
Amazing, smells, the decor the restrooms, the macaroons it was all amazing

I am sad to have to leave this poor review, as Amelie's used to be a neighborhood favorite of mine, but they are now a shell of their former self. I waited months to post this as I know the pandemic has hit everyone hard, but we are two years in now - it's adapt or die time.  The selection of pastry is usually abysmal these days, and even worse the quality of the food continues to decline. This was an issue even before Covid but it has gotten much worse. Service, never exactly a strong suit, is now completely in the gutter. Staff are not only slow, but surly and snarky, and seem to have no knowledge of the menu. Today I waited nearly twenty minutes for a single slice of quiche, which arrived almost cold and undercooked, during which time my coffee had also gone cold.  I can no longer recommend Amelie's to friends, and would instead suggest Villani's or Suarez bakeries.

Not the same as it used to be‚Ä¶ New location is terrible. It's not the big beautiful amelies that I remember. Now it's messy, tiny and extremely hot and stuffy! Our drinks were forgotten about (our order must have been checked off the screen because they had to re-add them) and we had to finally ask where they were after everyone who ordered after us got theirs, luckily the guy stopped what he was doing and started making them but didn't apologize or offer us anything to make up for it. On top of that my drink was extremely bitter when I know I ordered something sweet and my chocolate croissant was really disappointing with barely any chocolate inside. Sad that this place didn't live up to our memories and made a disappointing end to our anniversary trip. Will definitely be encouraging family and friends to not ever go back.
Food was excellent and fix the mistake on one of my sandwiches
Absolutely worth the hype - delicious food, good coffee, friendly staff, artsy vibes, a good place to sit and relax with a friend.

Really Amelies...normally good service but come on...you order a cold sandwich and they make you wait 20 minutes for it and then they don't even make it the way you asked...normally I wouldn't complain but not being able to walk outa there for less than 40$ and the orders not even right? Come on...do better...

I and two friends dropped in after a show to enjoy a dessert and a cup of coffee. Five minutes after being seated, a loud woman from the kitchen swept into the dining room and demanded that everyone leave as they were closing. There was no mention of lack of time when we made our purchase, clearly for consumption on premise. The available table where we were seated clearly was not cleaned nor sanitized. The staff was rude and pushy. I left the remains of my food on the table and began to leave when I was told that there was a garbage can. I reposted that since I had not had an opportunity to finish, I would not be using it. It is a sad thing that such a formerly lovely place has changed so dramatically.
Very good chicken salad on a croissant.

Absolutely love this place! Everything was delicious, including my croissant and coffee. The energy here is very upbeat and welcoming, it's friendly and warm and fun. There's a lot of seating and so many different kinds of baked goods! I really like this place and I definitely plan to come back!
Perfect stop for coffee, pastries, and breakfast sandwiches!

Gluten free macaroons, salted caramel brownie, and chocolate mouse (our favorite out of the 3) & many other non-gf items. Chill atmosphere to check your email & relax with friends or have a business meeting.
There isn't anything negative I can say about this location. Great service, delicious pastries and sandwiches and very cozy place.
The atmosphere is super friendly and fun! The service was great and the food is delicious

Parking was easy! The staff was friendly but the line was very long just to order. There is a good amount of seating and the wi-fi was fast. The food took about 45 minutes for this one sandwich. It was good but if it is going to take so long, the price should come down a bit.  Also, you just have to wait at the counter for your name to be called for your order. This is quite ineffective when the food takes so long to come out. I wasn't asked if my order was take out or not and it was packaged to go....and it STILL took 45 minutes.  Still, I've heard such good things about this place and it had a good vibe. I'll just eat elsewhere before coming here.  Also, I'm vegan and there were very limited options.

Used to love this place but last couple times they've been messing up my orders. Today I placed my order online to treat myself with some pastries and coffee. I came to the register to ask if it's ready and nobody paid attention to me. The employees were just casually having a conversation as if they didn't even see me. Then finally they told me that they are waiting for something and I was like ok. I'm thinking that they were waiting on my latte. I was standing there for at least 10 minutes looking at them chatting and then one of them called me saying that my order is ready but it wasn't even my order, it was somebody's else. He looked up my name to see what I had and said it's gonna be quick. Then he forgot my croissant and I had to go back and ask for it. And my latte was just terrible. I do not think I'm coming back because every time I have ordered from this place something is always wrong!!

We were amazed at the beautiful display of sweet treats. Very charming bakery decorated with amazing, one of a kind pieces. The homemade chandelier made out of mini strainers was so cool!! Loved the separate room where you can hang out with friends and family while you eat their amazing pastries. The front of the house manager was so sweet and kind. She was so friendly and we commented to each other when we left that we would love to hang out with her because she was so nice. We felt like family when we left there. Everything is delicious but you definitely need to get the macarons!! We will definitely be back!!

Absolutely amazing bakery! I'm not sure what's better, the service or the pastries! The front of house is phenomenal! The staff is so kind and knowledgeable. I'm from Florida so it's a bit of a drive but we'll worth it!! 10/10 for sure.

This place has a really cool atmosphere, a great outdoor seating area, and baked goods that will blow your mind! The line was very very long, but as long as you give yourself enough time it's worth it (there's a reason the line is always long). There's a lot of fun and funky artwork all around the store, and it makes the wait a lot more bearable. I come into town once every couple months and always make sure to stop by to try something new, you should too if you're ever in town.
Absolutely beautiful place! The desserts looked better than they tasted, though.

The only vegan options were a disgusting vegan creme brulee and a coffee drink that they were sold out of the ingredients to make. The creme brulee had no flavor. It was like unflavored milky jello. I only gave 3 stars because everything else looked good and it's not a vegan bakery.
Staff was rude and unprofessional‚Ä¶ After spending over $40 on pastries it will be our last visit. We've been regulars for over 5 years but no more.

Service was terrible at the Noda location. We got there about 20 minutes before closing time just stopping in to grab a dessert and coffee to go, only for Riley S. to roll her eyes at us and huff and puff as if she was mad we were there. I asked if there was any coffee left and she said no so we checked out. My husband had asked the barista if he had any left and he said he did. So I went back to the counter to tell Riley I wanted to buy a coffee and again she rolled her eyes and huffed and puffed acting mad that she had to ring me up a coffee. My friends behind me in line had asked if there was any left or if they could make some and she very rudely just said ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù. As she said this, my friends watched the barista behind the counter POUR OUT THE REST OF THE COFFEE and they refused to serve them. We were treated very rudely from the moment we got in line by this Riley person and will not return.
Always soooo good!!
I really enjoyed their coffee, savary and pastry. The place itself was cozy! People who worked there were very nice and respectful
Delicious fruit tarts and cakes: my favorites are Peach Tart and Palmier since they are not too sweet

Came back to Charlotte for a quick visit with my family from CT. Stopped by Amelies (as it's a known Charlotte staple), we got a breakfast sandwich on a light breakfast crescent and a iced cookie coffee that was to die for! So happy we stopped by on our way out of town. Everyone working behind the counter was also very nice and courteous.
Delish! I've been 3x different locations in the past week..its an expensive habit. But aahhhh so good

As an out-of-towner I found Am√©lie's to be a joy. Each and every item we purchased was outstandingly delicious. The service was sincerely friendly, the atmosphere was lovely, and the prices were lower than I expected. I will definitely visit again whenever I am nearby.
The staff including Justy treat you like family. The desserts are to die for. If you haven't been, you should go. If haven't been in a while go back.
Best place for dates
Great food. Nice workers. Worst service model of any cafe/pastry shop I've ever been too. Even when it isn't busy it takes forever to get your food and their online ordering maybe works half the time

If you're looking for a place to go grab something sweet after a meal and just sit down with friends while enjoying a sweet treat.. this is the place. They have food options as well but haven't tried it yet. I didn't give it a five star because one of the workers weren't super nice and was a little snappy. I also wish there was more pastry options too. The macaroons were delicious and the cheese cake (Amelie's style) was different and good. The layout was beautiful inside as well. Lots of unique chandeliers and pictures on the wall.

This is the first place in America I have found that have proper fresh cream cakes. I forgot to take photos of the variety of cakes we bought. We inhaled them so quickly, I did take photos of the Macroons amazing.  Everything was as good as the bakery's I go to in Paris .

One of my favorite French bakeries in the country, especially in the south this side of Charleston. Pastries are delicate and buttery and coffee is miles ahead of the green siren. Uniquely and creatively decorated, nice place to work when out of town.

Our first time here and let me give you a hint at my experience.  My girlfriend is one of these unusual women who is not a fan of chocolate and can always pass on it.  Myself,  I love chocolate and with dessert with chocolate filling and icing, I am in heaven. I got an Eclair and my girlfriend tried it and now she can't stop talking about it. We also got the coffee and this made heaven come down to Earth.  The coffee was rich and very flavorful and added to our enjoyment of the pastries and croissants.  Coming here really made our morning and if you get a chance stop in. Yeah you can fire up the coffee maker at home but sometimes you need to treat yourself.

The macarons were not done properly as there should not be any crunch to them.  The flavor was good but I'm very disappointed that the macarons were hard.  Macarons are supposed to be soft with cream in the middle.  Please stop putting that wafer/crunchy thing in the middle.

I loved this place . But it's always packed. And log queues for placing order . I liked their macarons and coffee. Other dessert options were a little too sweet for my liking but overall good experience.
I love the macaroons soooo many different flavors to choose from.

This place was awful! The food tasted terrible and the coffee was watered down, couldn't finish either of them. There was no soap or paper towels in both bathrooms and when I alerted the staff, they said it was a busy day for them. Very unprofessional! Space was very cramped and loud. Won't be going back
So good!! The line was very long though so make sure if you go you have time to wait. Well worth it!!

This place literally used to be the place I come to with friends and family like almost every weekend and then I don't know what happened maybe management changed because in the last year I kid you not it has completely changed
The wait was a bit long but so worth it. The breakfast sandwich was one of the best I've ever had and the tea cake was perfect. Will definitely make this a regular spot.
Pastries were fresh and delicious! Courteous and friendly staff! Definitely coming back!!
Great local bakery.  It has a unique atmosphere and is a nice place to sit and work, read, or hangout with friends.
No samples off the beat and track a little bit cute but no privacy in outdoor seating area not really worth taking away from other nice things in charlotte
Awesome service...great desserts
Absolutely delicious! I smiled with every bite. And the lemon raspberry tart. Yummmm. My new go to for when I am in south carolina.
Well worth it.

Really love this place. Great desserts and coffee, large selection. Wait times can be long. I only took away one star because the macrons, they look amazing but they never taste amazing. I've tried so many flavors and I can never differentiate which one I'm eating, and the tops are always so hard and not shiny. Plenty of other options that are really good like the croissants!
I am an out of town visitor. I try macaroons every place I visit and these were by far one of the best ones I've had.
Everything is delicious. My favorite was the Eclair üëåüèº
